name: James of Persia
Father Palladius
troparia: (Tone 4) You suffered awful torments at the hands of foreigners,* but you astonished everyone by the heroism of your endurance.* Each time one of your limbs was severed from your body,* you uttered a prayer of thanks to God.* For this you were crowned after your ordeal,* and you have been admitted to the court of heaven.* O long-suffering James, beg Him to save our souls.
kontakia: (Tone 2) You listened to your good wife* and meditated upon the judgment of God, O holy James.* You despised the threats and commands of the Persians* and accepted to be cut to pieces like a vine.* Therefore, you became a martyr worthy of admiration.
